items.title: Jimmy Lai, the Face of China’s Repression, to Receive the Bradley Prize
items.description: Lai’s story of suffering for freedom has, ironically, drawn the world’s attention to the very oppression the CCP tries so mightily to cover up.

items.title: Trump’s True Mandate from Voters: Make Life Easier
items.description: Showerheads and gas stoves may seem like small beer, but there’s a lot to be said for making people happy.

items.title: Congress Must Assert Itself on Tariffs
items.description: My bill would require Congress to approve any presidential proposal to impose tariffs before they are put into effect.

items.title: House Budget Hawks Are Right to Resist the Irresponsible Senate Plan
items.description: If Senate Republicans can’t commit to spending cuts in a blueprint, when will they?

items.title: Libraries Take a Hit in the Latest White House Order
items.description: A department supporting literacy, archive digitization, and conservation is set to sink into the briny deep.
